name: Let Poetry Be - Poetry Open Mic by Palgun K. J.
description:
This monthly gathering will see poetry coming to life, through reading, music, art and any other forms of artistic expression, at Atta Galatta. Listeners and performers are all welcome!
Date: 27th December
Time: 4pm 
Venue: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar
 
Event specifics & submission guidelines –
1. Theme - Free Verse (any original work)
2. Works can be original or of other poets, performed live
3. All languages welcome
4. Participants can read to music (acoustic instrument/s), dramatise, use props & costumes
5. Each participant will enjoy 5 minutes of reading time
6. Kindly submit your poem and name to letpoetrybe@gmail.com on or before 25th Dec midnight. WE WILL NOT ACCEPT ATTACHMENTS OR LINKS. SUBJECT OF YOUR MAIL MUST READ AS 'Entry for-December LPB meet-up'
7. You may also send entries that are not related to the theme
8. The event will begin at 4pm sharp and will be held at Atta Galatta. Participants to report not later than 3:45 pm to hear about performance order and meet the host
9. For any further clarifications, write to us at letpoetrybe@gmail.com
You are now welcome to flood our inbox!

name: Alchemy with Art - Art Workshop by Harshitha
description:
Atta Galatta presents 'Alchemy with Art' - a creative healing workshop guided by Harshitha on Sunday 28 December 2025 at 11:00 AM. 
In this second episode of Alchemy with Art, you will be guided through a transformative art session, balancing creative expression and inner work, with the intention of turning your personal pain into power. If this is meant for you, come join and leave empowered for the New Year. 
#AlchemywithArt #creativity #innerwholeness #healingcircle #Bengaluruevents #attagalatta

name: Read A Kitaab - Book club
description:
✨Grab your coffee, your mood, and your 2025 reading wrapup!
Join us for Read A Kitaab’s Book Club Meetup — this time, we’re diving in books you’ve read this year. 💭💥
📍 Atta Galatta, Indira Nagar, Bangalore
🗓 28 December| Sunday | 5–7 PM
Centered around a 2025 reading wrap-up, the session invites readers to share, listen, and reflect on the books that shaped their year. 🌈📚

name: Soul Climate - Book Launch by Inez Baranay
description:
Atta Galatta is delighted to host the launch of Soul Climate, the latest novel by acclaimed writer Inez Baranay. Inventive in form and rich with historical texture, Soul Climate reimagines the idea of India through the perspective of Turkish intellectual and freedom fighter Halide Edib, who visited Delhi in 1935 to deliver a series of lectures.
The novel deftly blends fact and fiction. Edib’s encounters with figures of India’s independence movement, including her conversations with Mahatma Gandhi, unfold alongside the fictional journeys of three young women whose lives are shaped by her words. Through these intertwined narratives, Soul Climate explores enduring questions of nationhood, communalism, idealism, and the ties that connect and divide us.
Inez Baranay, author of nine novels, has long been celebrated for her globally engaged and stylistically innovative work. Her earlier books Neem Dreams and With the Tiger were first published in India to critical acclaim.
The launch event will be hosted by Bhumika Anand, Founder and Director of the Bangalore Writers Workshop.

name: My Life Closed Twice - Book Launch by Subhashini Kaligotla
description:
Author Subhashini Kaligotla launches her new poetry collection My Life Closed Twice (Copper Coin, 2025), with Jeet Thayil.
In My Life Closed Twice, Subhashini Kaligotla charts the long aftermath of grief, and its recursive, obsessive cadences. Drawing on premodern India’s art, literature, and history, through invented forms and received ones, in fragments, litanies, lists, and queries, the poems in this spare volume embody the psychological terrain of the grieving. Two premature deaths are at the heart of the book. Kaligotla writes of their immediate aftereffects and their enduring impact. She braids her voice with voices from India’s past—from the unknown bards of the Sanskrit epics who counsel equanimity in the face of catastrophe to the laments of Ashoka, Bilhana, and Jahangir.
 
Author Bio
Subhashini Kaligotla is a poet and an art historian of ancient and medieval South Asia. She is author of the poetry collection Bird of the Indian Subcontinent and the monograph Shiva’s Waterfront Temples. She teaches at Columbia, dividing her time between New York City and Hyderabad.
 
Advance Praise for My Life Closed Twice
Subhashini Kaligotla’s ingeniously fashioned poetic structures—which are light, flexible, delicate yet possessed of remarkable tensile strength and architectural clarity and integrity—aren’t just beautiful in themselves. They’re also vessels for deep imaginative feeling and thinking and wondering and longing. She has a unique, compelling lyric voice and a distinguished twenty-first century consciousness.
- Vijay Seshadri
Anger, denial, bargaining, despair, all the stages of grief except acceptance, each stage overlaid with the forensic precision generated by love when it has nowhere to go. These enraged, laceratingly plainspoken poems burn with the singular self-awareness that is the writer's curse, and the writer's gift. Two deaths enclose the book like 'two dates // enclosed / by parentheses'. It is impossible to read, say, 'Only Your Brother Will You Lose' – its fifty shards hammered into the flesh like fifty nine-inch nails – and come away unscathed. 
- Jeet Thayil

name: Food & Beverage Founder's Meet - Meetup by Bindu Rao
description:
Calling all the Founders, Creators and Innovators in the Healthy eating space. This meet-up is designed exclusively to forge meaningful collaborations and connections worth your time.
Event Schedule:
1) Introductions: 3 minutes per brand and it must cover your name, designation, brand name & how can you help others? (60 minutes)
2) Snacks Break and Networking (30 minutes)
3) Guided knowledge sharing about flea markets, getting connects for packaging, food consultants, recipe developers, sourcing candidates and collaborating on content and curations for mutual growth on social media. (35 minutes)
4) Photography, Videography for Social Media (25 minutes)
Bindu Rao is a stand-up comedian turned food content creator and event coordinator who has conducted more than 1200 events across stand-up comedy, performance arts, food walks, founders only meets for the health conscious and beverage walks with Drickle Coffee (formerly Bonomi).
- Ticket is inclusive of veg & gluten free food, we start and end on time for the event.

name: Lahe Lahe Caravan presents “Harry Potter Book Discussion - Meetup by Sonali Bhatia
description:
For hard-core Potterheads age 12 and above!
Get into the minds of the characters, ferret out the intricacies of the plot - enter the wizarding world and share your thoughts and insights!
Will help if you have read all the Harry Potter books - this discussion will be based only on the books and not the movies.
The event is curated by Lahe Lahe Caravan and is being hosted at Atta Galatta.

name: Vanilla Hour - Book Launch with Neer Ya
description:
Join us at Atta Galatta for the launch of Vanilla Hour by Neer Ya on 9 January, from 2:00PM – 5:00 PM. The author will be present to launch the book and speak about the writing and themes behind the novel.
Vanilla Hour follows Dr. Nandini Yadav, a geochemist and single mother who has rebuilt her life after years of trauma. When an unexpected reunion takes her back to Goa and to a relationship she thought she had left behind, she is forced to confront memories and choices she has long avoided.
Moving between Delhi, Goa, and Tokyo, the novel explores love, loss, forgiveness, and the ways the past continues to shape the present. Blending elements of romantic suspense and literary fiction, Vanilla Hour is a thoughtful, emotionally grounded story about mothers and daughters, memory, and learning how to live without fear.

name: Meenu the Meemi - Book Launch by Dr.Sreelekha Kopparambil
description:
A dream dialogue with a little fish, Meenu, changes Nandu's life and gives him a purpose. As he decides to champion a rare cause with grit and determination, he faces many hurdles. Will Nandu succeed in his mission? What is this mission that Nandu has taken up? Who helps him on the way? To know more read, Meenu the Meemi, a dream fantasy about how a little fish befriends a little boy and how it changes lives of many others. 
* Free entry so no tickets to the event.

name: Let’s Walk - Book launch by Prakash Kannan
description:
Join us for an intimate evening at Atta Galatta as we celebrate the launch of "Let’s Walk" by Prakash Kannan. This is more than just a book release; it is an invitation to explore the quiet, lingering moments that define our lives.
The Story: "Let’s Walk" is a poignant tale of two strangers brought together by chance. Set against the rhythmic backdrop of city life, the story explores the beauty of timing, the weight of unspoken words, and the type of love that stays with you long after the final page.
 
The Event Experience:
· A Sneak Peek: Get an exclusive look into the heart of the story.
· Meet the Author: Hear Prakash Kannan share his creative journey and the deep emotions that inspired this book.
· Q&A: A chance to ask the author about the themes of timing and connection.
Location: Atta Galatta, Indira Nagar, Bengaluru Date: January 10, 2026 Time: 05:30 PM

name: Quiet Joys: A Gratitude Zine–Making Workshop - Workshop by Nitya Menon
description: Join us for an afternoon of quiet creativity. This workshop invites you to slow down, reflect on the small joys that often go unnoticed, and turn those moments into an 8-page gratitude zine. Through gentle prompts and simple illustration exercises, you’ll create a personal keepsake that captures what grounded you, moved you, or made you smile. It’s a reflective, hands-on session for anyone seeking a pause through creativity and mindful noticing. All materials will be provided, and no prior art experience is required.

name: Food In Literature - Book Club with Prachi Grover
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.  So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us for a dialogue on “Food in Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we read our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
January Read: In the Beginning there was Bombay Duck by Pronoti Datta
We assure you that you will enjoy every single bite! The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available. 
 
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who love to read and eat!
When: Saturday, 31st January, 2026 at 11 a.m.
Where: Atta Galatta Bookstore, Indira Nagar
Ages: 18+
Registration is mandatory (link in bio)
Copies of the book are available at the store.
